resources.name: D.O.O.R.S. Community Reentry Center - Antelope Valley
resources.description: Comprehensive reentry center providing housing, employment, education, substance use treatment, mental health services, legal aid, and benefits establishment for justice-involved individuals and their families in the Antelope Valley region (Lancaster/Palmdale).
services_offered: Substance use assessment and treatment linkage
Mental wellness linkage and medication support
resources.eligibility_requirements: Justice-involved individuals on adult felony supervision, their families, and the community. Priority for Antelope Valley residents.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Antelope Valley Lancaster Palmdale reentry services'

resources.name: South Bay One-Stop Business & Career Center - Carson
resources.description: Full-service career center providing employment services, job training, career counseling, and resources for job seekers including veterans, homeless individuals, and formerly incarcerated people across 11 South Bay cities.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers across 11 South Bay cities. Serves adults, youth, veterans, homeless individuals, and formerly incarcerated individuals. No income restrictions.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'South Bay Carson reentry employment'

resources.name: South Bay One-Stop Business & Career Center - Torrance
resources.description: Full-service career center providing comprehensive employment and training services for job seekers including those with barriers to employment. Offers skilled employment specialists, job listings, training programs, and placement services.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in South Bay region. Serves adults, youth, veterans, homeless individuals, and those with barriers to employment including criminal records.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'South Bay Torrance reentry employment'

resources.name: CLARE Foundation
resources.description: Comprehensive substance abuse treatment organization providing outpatient services, residential treatment, sober living, and recovery support for adults in Los Angeles since 1973. Multiple locations in Santa Monica and Culver City.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adults 18+ with substance abuse issues who live in Los Angeles area. Assessment required for program placement. Separate men's and women's programs available.
resources.fees: Accepts insurance including Medi-Cal, sliding scale available
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'CLARE Foundation Los Angeles substance abuse treatment'

resources.name: LA Family Housing
resources.description: Helps people transition out of homelessness and poverty through a continuum of housing enriched with supportive services. Provides permanent and transitional housing, case management, and wraparound services for families and individuals.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing or at risk of homelessness. Referrals preferred via email to referrals@lafh.org or call for screening.
resources.fees: Affordable rent based on income for housing programs
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'LA Family Housing supportive housing'

resources.name: New Life Beginnings
resources.description: Provides long-term shelter care and support for pregnant women and their children in crisis situations. Offers safe housing, case management, parenting education, and resources for women transitioning to independent living.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Pregnant women and mothers with children in crisis situations. Must be willing to participate in program services and work toward self-sufficiency.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'New Life Beginnings Los Angeles recovery'

resources.name: Foothill Family Services - Pasadena
resources.description: Mental health center providing comprehensive behavioral health services including substance abuse treatment, mental health counseling, and family therapy. Offers trauma-informed care with evidence-based therapeutic approaches.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families with mental health and/or substance abuse needs in Los Angeles County. Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, 24/7 ACCESS Center: 1-800-854-7771
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Foothill Family Services Los Angeles substance abuse mental health'

resources.name: Foothill Family Services - El Monte
resources.description: Mental health and substance abuse treatment center providing comprehensive behavioral health services to San Gabriel Valley communities. Offers evidence-based therapies and culturally-sensitive care.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families with mental health and/or substance abuse needs in Los Angeles County, particularly San Gabriel Valley. Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance.
resources.fees: Accepts Medi-Cal and other insurance, 24/7 ACCESS Center: 1-800-854-7771
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Foothill Family Services Los Angeles'

resources.name: Antelope Valley Partners for Health (AVPH)
resources.description: Community planning and advisory organization implementing health and community services through collaboration of local residents, agencies, faith-based organizations, and government entities in the Antelope Valley region.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Antelope Valley residents in need of community and health services. Call ahead for appointment to ensure staff availability.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Antelope Valley Partners for Health AVPH clinic'

notes: Sixth research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Geographic diversity: Antelope Valley (Lancaster), South Bay (Carson, Torrance), Westside (Santa Monica, Culver City), San Gabriel Valley (Pasadena, El Monte), Long Beach. Focus on employment centers (3), substance abuse treatment (2), mental health (2), housing (2), community services (1). All contact information verified from organization websites and official sources.
